name: Amulet
description: A holy symbol is a representation of a god or pantheon. A cleric or paladin can use a holy symbol as a spellcasting focus, as described in the Spellcasting section. To use the symbol in this way, the caster must hold it in hand, wear it visibly, or bear it on a shield.

name: Arcane Focus
description: An arcane focus is a special item—an orb, a crystal, a rod, a specially constructed staff, a wand-like length of wood, or some similar item—designed to channel the power of arcane spells. A sorcerer, warlock, or wizard can use such an item as a spellcasting focus, as described in the Spellcasting section.

name: Signet Ring
description: A signet ring is a piece of jewelry that bears the emblem of an influential family, guild, or religious group. It is typically used to seal important documents, and the magical properties of a signet ring can be used to verify the authenticity of a document.

name: Jeweler's Tools
description: These special tools include the items needed to pursue a craft or trade. The table shows examples of the most common types of tools, each providing items related to a single craft. Proficiency with a set of artisan's tools lets you add your proficiency bonus to any ability checks you make using the tools in your craft. Each type of artisan's tools requires a separate proficiency.

name: Gemstone (Azurite)
description: An opaque mottled deep blue gemstone worth 10 gold pieces.

name: Gemstone (Banded Agate)
description: A translucent striped brown, blue, white, or red gemstone worth 10 gold pieces.

name: Gemstone (Blue Quartz)
description: A transparent pale blue gemstone worth 10 gold pieces.

name: Gemstone (Eye Agate)
description: A translucent yellow and white, or yellow and blue, or yellow and red gemstone worth 10 gold pieces.

name: Gemstone (Hematite)
description: A solid gray-black gemstone worth 10 gold pieces.

name: Gemstone (Lapis Lazuli)
description: A deep blue, opaque gemstone worth 10 gold pieces.

name: Gemstone (Malachite)
description: A striped green gemstone worth 10 gold pieces.

name: Gemstone (Moss Agate)
description: A transparent pale blue, green, or red gemstone worth 10 gold pieces.

name: Gemstone (Obsidian)
description: A black or dark green, opaque gemstone worth 10 gold pieces.

name: Gemstone (Rhodochrosite)
description: A light pink gemstone worth 10 gold pieces.

name: Gemstone (Tiger Eye)
description: A golden-brown, opaque gemstone with a glowing, banded pattern worth 10 gold pieces.

name: Gemstone (Turquoise)
description: A clear sky-blue gemstone worth 10 gold pieces.

name: Gemstone (Bloodstone)
description: A dark gray with red flecks, opaque gemstone worth 50 gold pieces.

name: Gemstone (Carnelian)
description: An orange to red-brown, translucent gemstone worth 50 gold pieces.

name: Gemstone (Chalcedony)
description: A white, light blue, or pale gray, translucent gemstone worth 50 gold pieces.

name: Gemstone (Chrysoberyl)
description: A transparent yellow-green gemstone worth 50 gold pieces.

name: Gemstone (Citrine)
description: A transparent pale yellow-brown gemstone worth 50 gold pieces.

name: Gemstone (Jasper)
description: An opaque blue, black, or brown gemstone worth 50 gold pieces.

name: Gemstone (Moonstone)
description: A translucent white with pale blue glow gemstone worth 50 gold pieces.

name: Gemstone (Onyx)
description: A black with white bands, opaque gemstone worth 50 gold pieces.

name: Gemstone (Quartz)
description: A transparent white, smoky gray, or yellow gemstone worth 50 gold pieces.

name: Gemstone (Sardonyx)
description: A banded red and white, brown and white, or red and brown gemstone worth 50 gold pieces.

name: Gemstone (Star Rose Quartz)
description: A translucent rosy gemstone with a white star-shaped center worth 50 gold pieces.

name: Gemstone (Amber)
description: A transparent watery gold, green, or brown gemstone worth 100 gold pieces.

name: Gemstone (Amethyst)
description: A transparent deep purple gemstone worth 100 gold pieces.

name: Gemstone (Coral)
description: A pink to crimson, opaque gemstone worth 100 gold pieces.

name: Gemstone (Garnet)
description: A transparent red, brown-green, or violet gemstone worth 100 gold pieces.

name: Gemstone (Jade)
description: A translucent light green, deep green, or white gemstone worth 100 gold pieces.

name: Gemstone (Jet)
description: A deep black, lustrous gemstone worth 100 gold pieces.

name: Gemstone (Alexandrite)
description: A transparent dark green gemstone worth 500 gold pieces.

name: Gemstone (Black Pearl)
description: A lustrous black, gray, or purple gemstone worth 500 gold pieces.

name: Gemstone (Blue Spinel)
description: A transparent deep blue gemstone worth 500 gold pieces.

name: Gemstone (Peridot)
description: An olive-green, transparent gemstone worth 500 gold pieces.

name: Gemstone (Star Ruby)
description: A transparent deep red gemstone with a white star-shaped center worth 1000 gold pieces.

name: Gemstone (Star Sapphire)
description: A transparent blue gemstone with a white star-shaped center worth 1000 gold pieces.

name: Gemstone (Black Opal)
description: A translucent dark green with black mottling and golden flecks gemstone worth 1000 gold pieces.

name: Gemstone (Fire Opal)
description: A translucent fiery red gemstone worth 1000 gold pieces.

name: Gemstone (Emerald)
description: A deep bright green, transparent gemstone worth 1000 gold pieces.

name: Gemstone (Black Sapphire)
description: A transparent lustrous black gemstone worth 5000 gold pieces.

name: Gemstone (Diamond)
description: A transparent blue-white, canary, pink, brown, or blue diamond worth 5000 gold pieces.

name: Gemstone (Jacinth)
description: An transparent orange gemstone worth 5000 gold pieces.

name: Gemstone (Ruby)
description: A transparent deep red gemstone worth 5000 gold pieces.

name: Ring of Protection
description: While wearing this ring, you have advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects, and spells can't reduce your hit points to less than 1.

name: Ring of Animal Influence
description: This ring has 3 charges, and it regains 1d3 expended charges daily at dawn. While wearing the ring, you can use an action to expend 1 of its charges to cast one of the following spells: Animal Friendship (save DC 13), Fear (save DC 13), or Speak with Animals.

name: Ring of Feather Falling
description: When you fall while wearing this ring, you descend 60 feet per round and take no damage from falling. If you are within 30 feet of a solid surface, you can use your reaction to slow your fall to 60 feet per round until you land.

name: Ring of Invisibility
description: While wearing this ring, you can turn invisible as an action. Anything you are wearing or carrying is invisible with you. You remain invisible until the ring is removed, until you attack or cast a spell, or until you use a bonus action to become visible again.

name: Ring of Spell Storing
description: This ring stores spells cast into it, holding them until the attuned wearer uses them. The ring can store up to 5 levels worth of spells at a time. When found, it contains 1d6 - 1 levels of stored spells chosen by the DM.

name: Ring of Swimming
description: While wearing this ring, you have a swimming speed of 40 feet.

name: Ring of Warmth
description: While wearing this ring, you have resistance to cold damage. In addition, you and everything you wear and carry are unharmed by temperatures as low as -50 degrees Fahrenheit.

name: Amulet of Health
description: Your Constitution score is 19 while you wear this amulet. It has no effect on you if your Constitution is already 19 or higher.

name: Periapt of Wound Closure
description: While you wear this pendant, you stabilize whenever you are dying at the start of your turn. In addition, whenever you roll a Hit Die to regain hit points, double the number of hit points it restores.

name: Periapt of Health
description: You are immune to contracting any disease while you wear this pendant. If you are already infected with a disease, the effects of the disease are suppressed while you wear the pendant.

name: Necklace of Fireballs (small)
description: This necklace has 1d4 beads hanging from it. You can use an action to detach a bead and throw it up to 60 feet away. When it reaches the end of its trajectory, the bead detonates as a 3rd-level fireball spell (save DC 15). You can hurl multiple beads, or even the whole necklace, as one action. When you do so, increase the level of the fireball by 1 for each bead beyond the first.

name: Necklace of Fireballs (medium)
description: This necklace has 1d4+2 beads hanging from it. You can use an action to detach a bead and throw it up to 60 feet away. When it reaches the end of its trajectory, the bead detonates as a 3rd-level fireball spell (save DC 15). You can hurl multiple beads, or even the whole necklace, as one action. When you do so, increase the level of the fireball by 1 for each bead beyond the first.

name: Necklace of Fireballs (large)
description: This necklace has 2d4+4 beads hanging from it. You can use an action to detach a bead and throw it up to 60 feet away. When it reaches the end of its trajectory, the bead detonates as a 3rd-level fireball spell (save DC 15). You can hurl multiple beads, or even the whole necklace, as one action. When you do so, increase the level of the fireball by 1 for each bead beyond the first.
